text: Lima is a city in Allen County, Ohio, United States. The population of Lima was 35,579 in 2020. Lima was founded in 1831 as a county seat which was mandated by the Ohio legislature. It got its name from Patrick G. Goode, who was a judge. He insisted on the Spanish pronunciation "Lee-mah" after the capital city of Peru, but the pronunciation — "Lye-mah" — won. Professional wrestler Al Snow was born in Lima. Actor and movie critic Donald Richie was also born there. == References == ==Other websites== *The city government of Lima * Category:Cities in Ohio Category:County seats in Ohio Category:1831 establishments in Ohio
title: Lima, Ohio
